Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Magnesium Therapy in Carotid Endarterectomy

Trial_Design.evidence: 80 patients undergoing elective carotid endarterectomy were randomised

Intervention.evidence: randomised to a placebo group (n = 38) or one of three intravenous magnesium groups

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the amount and duration of phenylephrine required to maintain target systolic blood pressure post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 80 patients undergoing elective carotid endarterectomy were randomised

Result_Outcome.evidence: All treatment groups achieved significantly different magnesium levels from baseline at 12 and 24 hours (P < 0.01).
